intro: Faujasia pinifolia, commonly known as the pineleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, needle-like leaves that resemble pine needles. The plant produces bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, often blooming in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Faujasia pinifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in rock gardens and alpine settings.
